title: DevRelCon NY
description:
DevRelCon is the premier conference for anyone working to grow developer adoption — from Developer Relations and Developer Experience to Product Marketing, Platform Product Management, and Go-to-Market strategy. Join practitioners and leaders from the world's top developer platforms for talks, hands-on workshops, and the conversations that shape our craft.

Sessions cover AI developer tooling and platform strategy, developer-first go-to-market, measuring developer adoption and activation, positioning and messaging for technical audiences, community-led growth, documentation as product, building and scaling developer ecosystems, content strategy, career paths, and more.

howItWas.description: DevRelCon is a global series of conferences for the people building developer adoption — spanning developer relations, developer experience, product marketing, and go-to-market for developer platforms. Whether you're a DevRel practitioner, a product marketer reaching technical audiences, or a leader scaling a developer ecosystem, DevRelCon is where you'll find your people.
howItWas.label: See why you should attend DevRelCon!

ticketsBlock.title: Tickets
ticketsBlock.ticketsDetails: All tickets include full access to conference sessions across all 3 tracks, workshops, unconference, breakfast, lunch, coffee breaks, and the Day 1 evening reception. Travel and accommodations are not included.

team.description: DevRelCon is a global series of events, created by Hoopy, to provide a forum for developer relations and developer experience professionals share with other practitioners. Beginning in London in 2015, there are now also editions in Latin America, Prague, San Francisco, Tokyo and China. Major League Hacking joined up with Hoopy as the local organizer to bring DevRelCon back to the US starting in 2024 and beyond.

The Craft.title: The Craft
The Craft.description: Hands-on DevRel and DevEx practice — advocacy, content strategy, community building, events, and documentation.

The Strategy.title: The Strategy
The Strategy.description: Business impact, metrics, go-to-market, product marketing for developers, positioning, and organizational design.

The Platform.title: The Platform
The Platform.description: Developer experience, AI tooling, SDKs, APIs, onboarding, and building developer ecosystems at scale.

segments.title: AI Developer Tooling & Platform Teams
segments.description: Building or growing an AI developer platform? Get tactical on developer onboarding for AI APIs, agent frameworks, and model ecosystems — from docs and SDKs to community and go-to-market.

segments.title: Developer Relations & Advocacy
segments.description: Sharpen your craft with sessions on content strategy, community building, event ROI, and scaling programs. Connect with peers who understand the unique challenges of developer advocacy.

segments.title: Developer Experience & Platform Engineering
segments.description: Learn how leading companies design SDKs, docs, onboarding flows, and self-serve developer journeys. Take home frameworks for measuring and improving DX.

segments.title: Product Marketing for Developer Products
segments.description: Positioning, messaging, launches, and competitive strategy for technical audiences. Hear from practitioners who've cracked the code on developer-focused GTM.

segments.title: Product Management for Developer Platforms
segments.description: Roadmap prioritization, developer feedback loops, and the metrics that matter for platform products. Understand how DevRel, DX, and product work together.

segments.title: GTM & Ecosystem Leaders
segments.description: Understand how developer-first companies build their pipeline, measure community impact, and structure teams across DevRel, marketing, and product — especially in the AI era.

valueProps.title: Learn from practitioners, not just thought leaders
valueProps.description: Every speaker has done the work. Sessions focus on real strategies, real numbers, and lessons from real programs — not aspirational frameworks.

valueProps.title: Actionable takeaways you can use Monday morning
valueProps.description: Walk away with templates, frameworks, and playbooks you can put to work immediately — whether you're scaling a DevRel program, launching a developer product, or building an AI platform ecosystem.

valueProps.title: The right-sized room
valueProps.description: 300 practitioners who actually understand your challenges. Not 10,000 people where you're lost — intimate enough for real conversations, big enough for diverse perspectives.

valueProps.title: Cross-functional perspective
valueProps.description: The only conference where DevRel, developer marketing, product, and GTM leaders are in the same room solving the same problems together. Break out of your silo.

blocks.title: Organizers
blocks.description: DevRelCon NY is organized by Major League Hacking (MLH), the largest community of early career developers in the world. For 10 years, MLH has helped the world's top brands connect with developers. DevRelCon was created globally by Hoopy, the DevRel and developer marketing agency.

callToAction.label: Learn more about Major League Hacking

blocks.title: What is DevRelCon?
blocks.description: DevRelCon is a global series of events, created by Hoopy, to provide a forum for developer relations and developer experience professionals share with other practitioners. Beginning in London in 2015, there are now also editions in Latin America, Prague, San Francisco, Tokyo and China.

testimonials.quote: DevRelCon is the one conference where I don't have to explain what I do. Everyone here gets it — and the conversations are immediately actionable.
testimonials.name: [Name]
testimonials.title: Developer Advocate

testimonials.quote: I came as a product marketer at a developer tools company, not sure if this was for me. I left with a completely new GTM framework and a network I still lean on.
testimonials.name: [Name]
testimonials.title: Head of Product Marketing

testimonials.quote: The sessions on measuring developer adoption changed how our entire team thinks about success metrics. Worth the trip every year.
testimonials.name: [Name]
testimonials.title: VP Developer Experience

testimonials.quote: What sets DevRelCon apart is the mix of practitioners and leaders. You get tactical advice and strategic perspective in the same room.
testimonials.name: [Name]
testimonials.title: Director of Developer Relations

testimonials.quote: The AI and developer tooling sessions were exactly what our team needed as we figure out how to bring our AI platform to developers.
